answers.answer: Vitamin B12, whether in pill form or shots, along with iron and vitamin c, will help to improve your red blood cell count and assist you in getting your blood back to where it needs to be.  When your blood has recovered, your immunity will improve along with it.  Vitamin B12 has not been proven to help with weight loss by itself.  Many people "swear" by it when it is combined with another diet supplement or diet plan.  Try going over to the diet forum where many people have tried this as a supplementation to a diet plan. good luck

Vitamin B-12 is stored in the liver & is usually only depleted if you have a problem absorbing it thru your digestive system. The doctors sometimes give Vitamin B- 12 shots ,short term, if you are worn down from surgery or possibly another sickness which causes excessive weakness or fatigue. It con boost your enery level. There is no adverse affects with taking Vitamin B-12 unless you have an allergy to it & that is very unlikely.
